articles.title: National Day of DPRK Observed in Different Countries
President of Kyrgyzstan on Its Relations with DPRK
Withdrawal of U.S. Troops from S. Korea Demanded
articles.content:
President of Kyrgyzstan on Its Relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- There are the tradition of cooperation and potential for it between Kyrgyzstan and the DPRK. Kyrgyzstan is ready to boost the relations with the DPRK in all aspects of social life including politics, economy, science and culture. Its President Kurmanbek Bakiyev said this when receiving credentials from DPRK Ambassador Ri Tong Phal to that country on Aug. 30.
 He added: The Korean people are diligent and have many things similar to our people in cultural tradition and custom. I sincerely wish the DPRK progress, development and prosperity.

articles.title: Removal of MacArthur's Statue Urged
S. Korean New Seoul Opera Troupe Gives Performance
articles.content:
Removal of MacArthur's Statue Urged 
    Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- Yun Ki Jin, chairman of the South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification, reportedly issued an appeal on Sept. 1.
 The appeal says all the people are called to a struggle for the removal of the statue of MacArthur, the ringleader of aggression, by the urgent consciousness that the Korean nation has no future unless the U.S. troops are forced out of south Korea and the confidence that there is nothing impossible when the whole nation gets united.
 The south Korean organizations of the anti-U.S. movement are waging a relentless struggle to remove his statue in Inchon this year which marks the lapse of 60 years since the U.S. troops landed in south Korea, the appeal notes. 
 This struggle, it says, is of weighty importance in victoriously waging the fight in the standoff with the United States in the future.    
 It calls for a greater devotion and efforts of the south Korean youth and students in making this year the year of the withdrawal of the U.S. forces and the year of independent reunification.

articles.title: Palestinian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
S. Korean New Seoul Opera Troupe Gives Performance 
    Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- The New Seoul Opera Troupe of south Korea on a visit to Pyongyang staged the national opera "Oh, Koguryo, Koguryo, King Kwanggaetho" at the Ponghwa Art Theatre Wednesday.
 The opera depicts King Kwanggaetho and the struggle of the people in his age who contributed to strengthening Koguryo into a powerful and prosperous nation in the East. 
 Appreciating the performance were Kim Yong Dae, chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Social Democratic Party who is also chairman of the National Reconciliation Council, Kim Jong Ho, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of the Unions of Literature and the Arts of Korea, officials concerned, artistes and working people in Pyongyang.

articles.title: AINDF Pyongyang Mission Chief Interviewed
articles.content:
Palestinian Ambassador Hosts Reception 
    Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- Palestinian ambassador Shaher Mohammed Abdlah hosted a reception at his embassy Wednesday evening on the occasion of the 57th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Ryom Sun Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, Kim Kyong Ho, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, Pak Sun Hui, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.
 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.content:
DPRK's Stand to Seek Negotiated Peaceful Settlement of Nuclear Issue Clarified
    Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government consistently maintains the stand to seek a negotiated peaceful settlement of the nuclear issue and will exert tireless efforts to realize the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, said Premier Pak Pong Ju in a report delivered at the national meeting held at the April 25 House of Culture here Thursday to mark the 57th anniversary of the DPRK.
 The denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula was one of the last instructions of President Kim Il Sung and it remains an ultimate goal of the DPRK, he said.
 The DPRK is standing in acute stand-off with imperialist reactionaries, he said, declaring that its army and people will never tolerate the enemies' moves to isolate and stifle it but mercilessly foil them.

articles.title: Messages of Sympathy to Organizations of Koreans in U.S.
articles.content:
Koryo Acupoint Finder-Applier
    Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- The Koryo acupoint finder-applier developed in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has put acupuncture on a scientific basis.
 Prof. and Dr. Hyon Pyong Gun of Pyongyang University of Medicine, told KCNA that it is a medical apparatus which diagnoses disorders of the 12 channels with the use of the electrophysiological characters and applies needles at the relevant points.
 It helps give correct medical diagnosis and raise the efficacy of treatment.
 The clinical test shows 100 percent of treatment efficacy for the patients at initial stage and 70-80 percent for the 10 to 20-year long patients suffering from more than 50 kinds of diseases including Neurovegetative ataxia, pancreatitis, insomnia and bronchial asthma.    
 It, which was highly appreciated in the Moscow International Invention Exhibition, has been applied in various countries including Venezuela.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Foreign Diplomats
articles.content:
Messages of Sympathy to Organizations of Koreans in U.S.
    Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- The Korean Committee for Aiding Overseas Compatriots Wednesday sent messages of sympathy to the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. and the Federation of Koreans in the Middle and South Regions of the U.S. in connection with the fact that southern areas of the U.S. were hard hit by Hurricane Katrina recently.
 The messages expressed deep consolation and sympathy with the victims and sincerely hoped that the inhabitants in the afflicted areas including Koreans would recover from the damage done by hurricane and their living return to normal as early as possible.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Foreign Diplomats
    Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a floral basket and congratulatory letters from the military attaches corps and the economic and commercial councilors corps here on Thursday on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the DPRK.
 A congratulatory letter was conveyed to an official concerned by Military Attache of the Vietnamese embassy Nguyen Van Chau on behalf of the military attaches corps and a floral basket and a congratulatory letter to an official concerned by Commercial Councilor of the Cuban embassy Evelio Duenas Ponce, who is doyen of the economic and commercial councilors corps.

articles.title: Joint Statement of Koreans Published
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Delegation
    Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the Liaoning Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China headed by its Secretary Li Keqiang, chairman of the Standing Committee of the Liaoning Provincial People's Congress, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.
 On hand were officials concerned and the Chinese ambassador to the DPRK. 
 On the occasion the head of the delegation said that the Korean people under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il are now registering great successes in various domains including economic development and the efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations.
 The Sino-Korean friendly and cooperative relations are steadily developing under the great care of Hu Jintao and Kim Jong Il, he said.    
 He hoped that the Korean people rallied close around Kim Jong Il would gain greater success in their efforts to build a great prosperous powerful nation under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
